comment: Easy class if you have taken Spanish. Vocab quizzes very easy and multiple choice. Test are ok if u barely study, online assignments a breeze. He is really old and slow it takes 20 mins for him to do the attendance seating chart. Yes you have assigned seats. I went to class and did nothing and made an A. NOT RECOMMENDED if you never taken Spanish.

Very easy class if you have taken any spanish. Online homework except for a few short paragraphs(easy). one short presentation(easy). Highly recommend. Can miss 2 days of class After that one point is lost for each class you miss. Extra point opportunities. Vocab Quizzes are easy & mult. choice. Tests are pretty easy too mainly mult choice.take him

If you took more than two years of Spanish in high school you'll be so bored in his class. He's Haitian, so having a man with a French accent trying to teach you Spanish is rather difficult to understand. He's old and he forgets things a lot which is really frustrating. Overall it's a super easy A and worth being bored out of your mind.

He was extremely easy. Seriously, you would have to bomb everything to make a B. Extra credit out the ears. Anyway, class was a snooze, but he takes off one overall grade point per day that you miss, so go to class. He's very respectful, however, if you haven't yet had exposure to Spanish, it will feel like he is expecting a lot out of you.
This man needs to retire. Entirely too old. He was ridiculous. Do NOT take.

I had never studied Spanish before, but this class was easy. I enjoyed his teaching. You should do fine if you just attend the classes, take notes, do your homework, and take responsibility of your own learning.
There is a time when a person needs to realize when it is time to retire. This instructor is at that stage.  Not a mean guy, just need to go ...

Hard to understand and expects you to have had some kind of Spanish before. I ended up dropping the class because I have had no Spanish and expected an intro class to introduce me. He wanted us speaking sentences the first day. Take another if possible,unfortunately they rarely post the Professors for Spanish until the beginning of the semester.

If you can take another professor, do it. He speaks Spanish a lot and wants you to speak it too, even if you don't know it that well. His study guides were not really study guides... They didn't help at all for the test. His grading system is very confusing and stupid. Class is very boring. Take somebody else.

His class is very easy if you've had spanish in the past.Tests are mostly writing sections couple of multiple choice culture questions.If you need help you can go to the spanish lab on campus and he'll give you extra credit for it. Homework done online, and there are 4 writing assignments for the semester that are really easy. Funny old man!

Extremely easy class if you have had spanish before. He is really nice and very lenient with grades. Quizzes are multiple choice and incredible easy. He gives a lot of extra credit. Very easy to make an A.

Great teacher. his english isnt all that bad but he does have a strong accent. his tests are over waht he teaches but u do have to take notes. all the main things are on review sheets he gives right before the tests.

Nice man but very hard to understand, and doesn't speak English well. His notes were scattered and hard to follow. His tests were ridiculously hard and way too advanced. Treated us like an advanced Spanish class instead of teaching the basics. Not recommended for Spanish I or II, but maybe he is better in the more advanced Spanish classes.

Not a very good teacher. Can be hard to understand. Seems like he does not know what is going on half of the time. Probably should retire. Very easy though. Just have to study, do not expect alot from him, and pray he get your grade right at the end of the semester.

The worst teacher. Cannot speak English. Very old, perhaps his mind is going senile. Gives grades arbitrarily whether he likes you or not. You could earn an A on everything and he'll give you a C if he feels like it. And he keeps all of your work so you have no way to dispute or prove your grade.

A real sweetheart!  Will postpone tests and quizzes until entire class is ready. Babies those who are unsure of their french and explains the "why" of things. Lots of grammar and speaking-great teacher!
Has an accent, many quizzes and test. 1 portfolio and journal to turn in. Easy class. Takes attendace and starts taking off points by the 3rd absence
Takes attendance, which sucks. Can't explain anything. Hard to understand. Chooses favorites & therefore doesn't grade fairly. But the work load is pretty easy.
The best french prof. Ive ever had! Has a Haitian accent, but is SOO nice, understanding and helpful! HIGHLY highly recommend taking his class! Puts fun back into learning a foreign language.
